IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO EDUCATE STUDENTS IN MIND, BODY, AND SPIRIT IN ORDER TO: 1) PREPARE THEM FOR THE CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES OF HIGHER EDUCATION; 2) HELP THEM LEARN TO LOVE AND RESPECT THEMSELVES AND THEIR FELLOW STUDENTS, AND TO CARE FOR THOSE IN LESS FORTUNATE CIRCUMSTANCES; 3) TEACH THEM TO BE RESPONSIBLE STEWARDS OF OUR NATURAL HERITAGE; 4) REMIND THEM THAT ONE MAN OR WOMAN OF PRINCIPLE CAN ALWAYS MAKE A DIFFERENCE.

IRS990.Desc: SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER FINANCIAL AID BASED ON NEED

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PRIVATE SECONDARY SCHOOL UTILIZED BY APPROXIMATELY 225 BOARDING AND DAY STUDENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: KENTS HILL SCHOOL IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. HOWEVER, INCOME FROM CERTAIN ACTIVITIES NOT DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE SCHOOL'S TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE IS SUBJECT TO TAXATION AS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. IN ADDITION, THE SCHOOL QUALIFIES FOR THE CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTION DEDUCTION UNDER SECTION 170(B)(1)(A)(II). EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2009, THE SCHOOL ADOPTED THE PROVISIONS OF FASB INTERPRETATION NO. 48, ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES (FIN 48, AS CODIFIED BY ASC 740, INCOME TAXES). THIS STATEMENT CLARIFIES THE CRITERIA THAT AN INDIVIDUAL TAX POSITION MUST SATISFY FOR SOME OR ALL OF THE BENEFITS OF THAT POSITION TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. ASC 740 PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD OF MORE LIKELY-THAN-NOT, AND A MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTE FOR ALL TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN ON A TAX RETURN, IN ORDER FOR THOSE TAX POSITIONS TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. MANAGEMENT EVALUATED THE SCHOOL'S TAX POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT THE SCHOOL HAD TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRED ADJUSTMENT TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO COMPLY WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS GUIDANCE. AS A RESULT, THERE WAS NO CUMULATIVE EFFECT RELATED TO ADOPTION AND NO INTEREST OR PENALTIES RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS WERE ACCRUED. WHEN NECESSARY, THE SCHOOL ACCOUNTS FOR INTEREST AND PENALTIES RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS PART OF ITS PROVISION FOR FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAXES. THE SCHOOL DOES NOT EXPECT THAT UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS ARISING FROM TAX POSITIONS WILL CHANGE SIGNIFICANTLY WITHIN THE NEXT TWELVE MONTHS. THE SCHOOL IS CURRENTLY OPEN TO AUDIT UNDER THE STATUTE OF LIMITATIONS BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AND STATE TAXING AUTHORITIES FOR THE YEARS ENDING JUNE 30, 2013 THROUGH 2016.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 4B

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL HAS PUBLICIZED ITS RACIALLY NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IN ITS NEWSPAPER AND BROADCAST MEDIA ADS.

THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO EDUCATE STUDENTS IN MIND, BODY, AND SPIRIT IN ORDER TO: 1) PREPARE THEM FOR THE CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES OF HIGHER EDUCATION; 2) HELP THEM LEARN TO LOVE AND RESPECT THEMSELVES AND THEIR FELLOW STUDENTS, AND TO CARE FOR THOSE IN LESS FORTUNATE CIRCUMSTANCES; 3) TEACH THEM TO BE RESPONSIBLE STEWARDS OF OUR NATURAL HERITAGE; 4) REMIND THEM THAT ONE MAN OR WOMAN OF PRINCIPLE CAN ALWAYS MAKE A DIFFERENCE.
THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED FIRST BY THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER AND CONTROLLER AND THEN IS FORWARDED TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.
THIS PROCESS WILL BE IMPLEMENTED AT THE NEXT BOARD OF TRUSTEES MEETING.
THE SCHOOL'S HEADMASTER'S COMPENSATION WAS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.
THE FORM 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH GUIDESTAR AND THE SCHOOL WILL PROVIDE A COPY OF THE 990 UPON REQUEST.
